thread.title: Eddie Obeid makes fresh bid for freedom
thread.title_full: Eddie Obeid makes fresh bid for freedom

author: Michaela Whitbourn
title: Eddie Obeid makes fresh bid for freedom
text:
Eddie Obeid outside the NSW Supreme Court in December. Photo: Daniel Munoz 
The court is expected to hear the former Labor powerbroker's appeal against conviction as early as May. 
Mr Reynolds said his client should be released on bail pending that appeal. Advertisement 
Supreme Court Justice Robert Beech-Jones knocked back Obeid's first application for bail last year. 
An appeal to the Court of Criminal Appeal in the days before Christmas was also unsuccessful. 
Mr Reynolds said the appeal against conviction was "10 times bigger than most of the things I deal with" and was likely to raise a "very major constitutional issue". 
He intends to argue that only Parliament, rather than the Supreme Court, has jurisdiction to deal with cases of misconduct in public office. 
The case may require a bench of five judges rather than the usual three. 
The Court of Criminal Appeal fixed a tentative date of March 15 to hear the bail application. 
The parties return to court on March 2. Advertisement
